thread.title: SC to consider CBI plea against Virbhadra Singh on 26 October
thread.title_full: SC to consider CBI plea against Virbhadra Singh on 26 October - Livemint

author: Shreeja Sen
title: SC to consider CBI plea against Virbhadra Singh on 26 October
text:
New Delhi: The Supreme Court on Thursday said that it would consider Central Bureau of Investigation’s (CBI) plea seeking its intervention for probe into Himachal Pradesh chief minister Virbhadra Singh in relation to a corruption case on 26 October.
The CBI moved the court saying the Himachal Pradhesh high court had virtually restrained the probe against Singh, although the first information report (FIR) in the case was registered in Delhi.
Chief justice of India H.L. Dattu said that an apex court bench would consider the case on 26 October. He refused an early hearing of the case. CBI, represented by additional solicitor general P.S. Patwalia, had asked the court to consider the case initially on Friday.
Patwalia told the court that the high court’s order restrained the CBI from pursuing all aspects of investigation. He said that the CBI would have to approach the high court for its permission before questioning Singh and his wife, taking them into custody, among other protections.
The Himachal high court on 1 October had protected Singh and his wife from arrest, but allowed the CBI to proceed with the inquiry, albeit with several conditions.
PTI contributed to this report.
